items.sentence: You\'re never going to believe what happened today.

You\'re the only person who ever comes to visit me.
A child whose parents are dead is called an orphan.
Tom\'s vacation plans dovetail nicely with Mary\'s.
Tom said that he doesn\'t know how to speak French.
Tom says he\'ll do that again if Mary wants him to.
What\'s important is not the goal, but the journey.
What\'s the difference between a star and a planet?
Tom will probably be asleep by the time I get home.
Tom works in the laundry room at a hotel in Boston.
You\'ll have to go to Boston to meet Tom next week.
You\'re not allowed to bring food into the library.
Tom asked me to help Mary with her French homework.
Let\'s celebrate the anniversary of our first kiss.
Let\'s get down to brass tacks and make a decision.
You\'re under arrest for the murder of Tom Jackson.
You\'re wearing an expensive-looking pair of shoes.

After a ten-minute break, we resumed our rehearsal.
All the letters I received from Tom were in French.
Tom looked out the window to see what was going on.
Tom suspects Mary is the one who stole his bicycle.

Tom couldn\'t understand why Mary didn\'t like him.

Tom was whistling a song his mother had taught him.
Tom washes his face every morning before breakfast.
It looks like the thief came in through the window.
Tom fell asleep as soon as his head hit the pillow.
Tom fell asleep at the wheel and hit a street lamp.
Tom fell asleep the moment his head hit the pillow.

I don\'t think I could ever get used to this smell.
I don\'t think Tom is aware of his own limitations.

You\'re not the kind of girl I usually go out with.

What\'s the worst thing that could possibly happen?
Whatever you do, don\'t complain to Tom about this.
I don\'t want to hear any more of your complaining.
Tom told me he didn\'t study French in high school.

Let me think it over, and I\'ll let you know later.
